High Risk Condition (Red Flag): No security policies, no certifications, no independent oversight
Medium Risk Condition (Amber Flag): Policies exist but controls are self-attested only; no recent independent review
Low Risk Condition (Green Flag): ISO/IEC 27001 or SOC 2 Type II certification in place

High Risk Condition (Red Flag): No encryption at rest or in transit
Medium Risk Condition (Amber Flag): Encryption in place but key management is opaque or vendor-controlled only
Low Risk Condition (Green Flag): Encryption at rest and in transit with clear key management practices

High Risk Condition (Red Flag): MFA not enforced for users with access to customer data
Medium Risk Condition (Amber Flag): MFA enforced but shared or generic accounts exist
Low Risk Condition (Green Flag): MFA enforced globally with named accounts and RBAC

Medium Risk Condition (Amber Flag): Notification commitment exists but exceeds 72 hours

High Risk Condition (Red Flag): No backups or backups not tested
Medium Risk Condition (Amber Flag): Backups exist but restoration testing is infrequent or RTO > 24 hours
Low Risk Condition (Green Flag): Daily backups with tested restoration and defined RTO < 4 hours

High Risk Condition (Red Flag): No penetration testing or testing older than 2 years
Medium Risk Condition (Amber Flag): Internal testing only or limited external testing
Low Risk Condition (Green Flag): Independent third-party penetration testing performed annually with no critical open findings
